trans-unit.source: Creates an instance of a named pipe

seg-source.mrk: Creates an instance of a named pipe

target.mrk: Creates an instance of a named pipe

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Pipe name with the following format: \\.\pipe\pipename.

seg-source.mrk: Pipe name with the following format:
\\.\pipe\pipename.

target.mrk: Pipe name with the following format:
\\.\pipe\pipename.

trans-unit.source: The pipename part of the name can include any character other than a backslash, including numbers and special characters.

seg-source.mrk: The pipename part of the name can include any character other than a backslash, including numbers and special characters.

target.mrk: The pipename part of the name can include any character other than a backslash, including numbers and special characters.

trans-unit.source: The pipe name string can be up to 256 characters long.

seg-source.mrk: The pipe name string can be up to 256 characters long.

target.mrk: The pipe name string can be up to 256 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Pipe names are not case sensitive.

seg-source.mrk: Pipe names are not case sensitive.

target.mrk: Pipe names are not case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The pipe access mode. Must be one of the following:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The pipe access mode.
Must be one of the following:

target.mrk: [optional]
The pipe access mode.
Must be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: 0 - The flow of data in the pipe goes from client to server only (inbound)

seg-source.mrk: 0 - The flow of data in the pipe goes from client to server only (inbound)

target.mrk: 0 - The flow of data in the pipe goes from client to server only (inbound)

trans-unit.source: 1 - The flow of data in the pipe goes from server to client only (outbound)

seg-source.mrk: 1 - The flow of data in the pipe goes from server to client only (outbound)

target.mrk: 1 - The flow of data in the pipe goes from server to client only (outbound)

trans-unit.source: 2 - The pipe is bi-directional (duplex)

seg-source.mrk: 2 - The pipe is bi-directional (duplex)

target.mrk: 2 - The pipe is bi-directional (duplex)

trans-unit.source: [optional] The pipe flags. Can be any combination of the following:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The pipe flags.
Can be any combination of the following:

target.mrk: [optional]
The pipe flags.
Can be any combination of the following:

trans-unit.source: 1 - If you attempt to create multiple instances of a pipe with this flag, creation of the first instance succeeds, but creation of the next instance fails.

seg-source.mrk: 1 - If you attempt to create multiple instances of a pipe with this flag, creation of the first instance succeeds, but creation of the next instance fails.

target.mrk: 1 - If you attempt to create multiple instances of a pipe with this flag, creation of the first instance succeeds, but creation of the next instance fails.

trans-unit.source: 2 - Overlapped mode is enabled. If this mode is enabled functions performing read, write, and connect operations that may take a significant time to be completed can return immediately.

seg-source.mrk: 2 - Overlapped mode is enabled.
If this mode is enabled functions performing read, write, and connect operations that may take a significant time to be completed can return immediately.

target.mrk: 2 - Overlapped mode is enabled.
If this mode is enabled functions performing read, write, and connect operations that may take a significant time to be completed can return immediately.

trans-unit.source: 4 - Write-through mode is enabled. This mode affects only write operations on byte type pipes and only when the client and server are on different computers.

seg-source.mrk: 4 - Write-through mode is enabled.
This mode affects only write operations on byte type pipes and only when the client and server are on different computers.

target.mrk: 4 - Write-through mode is enabled.
This mode affects only write operations on byte type pipes and only when the client and server are on different computers.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Security ACL flags. Can be any combination of the following:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Security ACL flags.
Can be any combination of the following:

target.mrk: [optional]
Security ACL flags.
Can be any combination of the following:

trans-unit.source: 1 - The caller will have write access to the named pipe's discretionary ACL

seg-source.mrk: 1 - The caller will have write access to the named pipe's discretionary ACL

target.mrk: 1 - The caller will have write access to the named pipe's discretionary ACL

trans-unit.source: 2 - The caller will have write access to the named pipe's owner

seg-source.mrk: 2 - The caller will have write access to the named pipe's owner

target.mrk: 2 - The caller will have write access to the named pipe's owner

trans-unit.source: 4 - The caller will have write access to the named pipe's security ACL

seg-source.mrk: 4 - The caller will have write access to the named pipe's security ACL

target.mrk: 4 - The caller will have write access to the named pipe's security ACL

trans-unit.source: [optional] Pipe type mode. Must be one of the following:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Pipe type mode.
Must be one of the following:

target.mrk: [optional]
Pipe type mode.
Must be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: 0 - Data is written to the pipe as a stream of bytes

seg-source.mrk: 0 - Data is written to the pipe as a stream of bytes

target.mrk: 0 - Data is written to the pipe as a stream of bytes

trans-unit.source: 1 - Data is written to the pipe as a stream of messages

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Data is written to the pipe as a stream of messages

target.mrk: 1 - Data is written to the pipe as a stream of messages

trans-unit.source: [optional] Pipe read mode. Must be one of the following:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Pipe read mode.
Must be one of the following:

target.mrk: [optional]
Pipe read mode.
Must be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: 0 - Data is read from the pipe as a stream of bytes

seg-source.mrk: 0 - Data is read from the pipe as a stream of bytes

target.mrk: 0 - Data is read from the pipe as a stream of bytes

trans-unit.source: 1 - Data is read from the pipe as a stream of messages

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Data is read from the pipe as a stream of messages

target.mrk: 1 - Data is read from the pipe as a stream of messages

trans-unit.source: [optional] Pipe wait mode. Must be one of the following:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Pipe wait mode.
Must be one of the following:

target.mrk: [optional]
Pipe wait mode.
Must be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: 0 - Blocking mode is enabled. When the pipe handle is specified in ReadFile, WriteFile, or ConnectNamedPipe, the operation is not completed until there is data to read, all data is written, or a client is connected.

seg-source.mrk: 0 - Blocking mode is enabled.
When the pipe handle is specified in ReadFile, WriteFile, or ConnectNamedPipe, the operation is not completed until there is data to read, all data is written, or a client is connected.

target.mrk: 0 - Blocking mode is enabled.
When the pipe handle is specified in ReadFile, WriteFile, or ConnectNamedPipe, the operation is not completed until there is data to read, all data is written, or a client is connected.

trans-unit.source: 1 - Nonblocking mode is enabled. ReadFile, WriteFile, and ConnectNamedPipe always return immediately.

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Nonblocking mode is enabled.
ReadFile, WriteFile, and ConnectNamedPipe always return immediately.

target.mrk: 1 - Nonblocking mode is enabled.
ReadFile, WriteFile, and ConnectNamedPipe always return immediately.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The maximum number of instances that can be created for this pipe

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The maximum number of instances that can be created for this pipe

target.mrk: [optional]
The maximum number of instances that can be created for this pipe

trans-unit.source: [optional] The number of bytes to reserve for the output buffer

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The number of bytes to reserve for the output buffer

target.mrk: [optional]
The number of bytes to reserve for the output buffer

trans-unit.source: [optional] The number of bytes to reserve for the input buffer

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The number of bytes to reserve for the input buffer

target.mrk: [optional]
The number of bytes to reserve for the input buffer

trans-unit.source: [optional] The default time out value, in milliseconds

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The default time out value, in milliseconds

target.mrk: [optional]
The default time out value, in milliseconds

trans-unit.source: [optional] a $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new named pipe and determines whether child processes can inherit the returned handle.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
a $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new named pipe and determines whether child processes can inherit the returned handle.

target.mrk: [optional]
a $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new named pipe and determines whether child processes can inherit the returned handle.

trans-unit.source: If $tSecurity is 0, the named pipe gets a default security descriptor and the handle cannot be inherited.

seg-source.mrk: If $tSecurity is 0, the named pipe gets a default security descriptor and the handle cannot be inherited.

target.mrk: If $tSecurity is 0, the named pipe gets a default security descriptor and the handle cannot be inherited.

trans-unit.source: The ACLs in the default security descriptor for a named pipe grant full control to the LocalSystem account administrators, and the creator owner.

seg-source.mrk: The ACLs in the default security descriptor for a named pipe grant full control to the LocalSystem account administrators, and the creator owner.

target.mrk: The ACLs in the default security descriptor for a named pipe grant full control to the LocalSystem account administrators, and the creator owner.

trans-unit.source: They also grant read access to members of the Everyone group and the anonymous account.

seg-source.mrk: They also grant read access to members of the Everyone group and the anonymous account.

target.mrk: They also grant read access to members of the Everyone group and the anonymous account.

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: a handle to the server end of a named pipe instance.

seg-source.mrk: a handle to the server end of a named pipe instance.

target.mrk: a handle to the server end of a named pipe instance.
